SEARCH
Package HWSystem.Port

Class Port

java.lang.Object
HWSystem.Port.Port
public class Port extends Object
Represents a hardware port in the system. Each port is associated with a specific protocol and can host one device at a time. It also maintains a stack-based log of actions and events.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs a port with the given ID and protocol.

  • Constructor Details

    • Port

      public Port(int id, Protocol p)
      Constructs a port with the given ID and protocol. Initially, the port has no connected device.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the port
      p - the communication protocol used by this port

  • Method Details

    • getportID

      public int getportID()
      Returns the ID of the port.
      Returns:
      the port ID

    • getPortName

      public String getPortName()
      Returns a string representation of the port's name.
      Returns:
      the name of the port (e.g., "Port2")

    • getProtocol

      public Protocol getProtocol()
      Returns the protocol used by this port.
      Returns:
      the port's protocol

    • isEmpty

      public Boolean isEmpty()
      Checks whether the port is currently empty (i.e., no device is connected).
      Returns:
      true if no device is connected, false otherwise

    • setDevice

      public void setDevice(Device device)
      Connects a device to the port.
      Parameters:
      device - the device to connect

    • removeDevice

      public void removeDevice()
      Disconnects any device currently connected to the port.

    • getDevice

      public Device getDevice()
      Returns the device currently connected to this port.
      Returns:
      the connected device, or null if none

    • addLog

      public void addLog(String entry)
      Adds a log entry to the port's log stack.
      Parameters:
      entry - the log message to add

    • getLogStack

      public Stack<String> getLogStack()
      Returns the entire log stack of the port.
      Returns:
      the stack of log messages

    • getLogFileName

      public String getLogFileName()
      Returns the file name used to store the port's log. The format is "<ProtocolName>_<PortID>.log".
      Returns:
      the log file name for this port
